solution: Because $3\ge -2,$ we use the second case to determine that $f(3) = 5-2(3) = \boxed{-1}.$
model_solution:
Step 1: Identify the given function and the input value.
\[f(x) =
\begin{cases}
2x + 9 &\text{if }x<-2, \\
5-2x&\text{if }x\ge -2.
\end{cases}
\]
We need to find $f(3)$.

Since the input value $x=3$ is greater than $-2$, we will use the second piece of the function, $f(x)=5-2x$.
Step 2: Plug in $x=3$ into the equation $f(x)=5-2x$ to find $f(3)$.
Substitute 3 for $x$ in the equation $f(x)=5-2x$ to get $f(3)=5-2(3)$.
Simplify the equation $f(3)=5-2(3)$ to get $f(3)=5-6$.
Simplify the equation $f(3)=5-6$ to get $f(3)=-1$.
Since the input value $x=3$ is greater than $-2$, we will use the second piece of the function, $f(x)=5-2x$. Plug in $x=3$ into the equation $f(x)=5-2x$ to find $f(3)$. $f(3)=5-2(3)$
Simplify the equation $f(3)=5-2(3)$ to get $f(3)=5-6$.
